page.title: 09Elvington Treatment Works.
page.content: Elvington treatment works treats water from the river Derwent.Then it is used by people in the home for drinks,bath water and so on .The water is pumped into the works from the river and put into special tanks.Chemicals are add to change the colour and to get rid of bacteria which might cause disease. The people at the works remove the used chemicals and dirt as sludge through a large under water draw-off bucket.This allows the clean water to be taken off.All the used chemicals and bacteria are pumped to the sludge lagoons.The water is pumped by the treatmant works into the Yorkshire Water Grid System.Then it goes to cities like Barnsley,Leeds,Rotherham and Sheffield.This helps to provide large numbers of people with the water they need.
